newsitem.title: USA: Document Sciences sees lower Q4 earnings.
newsitem.headline: Document Sciences sees lower Q4 earnings.

text.p: Document Sciences Corp said on Monday that revenues for the fourth quarter were expected to be between $4.6 million and $4.7 million.
This compares with $4.0 million reported for the fourth quarter of 1995 and $4.1 million reported for the third quarter of 1996.

Net income is expected to be about $640,000 or $0.06 per share compared with $802,000 or $0.10 cents per share for the same quarter a year ago and $333,000 or $0.04 cents per share for the immediately preceding quarter, the company said.

For 1996, total revenues would be about $15.1 million and net income about $1.2 million, or $0.12 cents to $0.13 cents per share. This compares with total revenues of $10.5 million and net income of $1.05 million or $0.12 cents per share in 1995, the company said.
Final financial results for the fourth quarter and for 1996 will be announced January 27, the company said.
Document Sciences provides document automation software and services used in high-volume electronic publishing applications.
